alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Big Horn, west central Powder River and southern Rosebud Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 610 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Busby to 8 miles northeast of Lodge Grass. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Busby, Ashland, Lame Deer, Kirby, Muddy Cluster, Birney Village and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud
